Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2008 09:58PM TheShopMama wrote: I am glad you came here, Jude.  I had a 2.5 centimeter tumor, with no lymph node involvement.  It was HER2+ and ER/PR-.  I had a lumpectomy (with 3 re excisions for clean margins) followed by 6 rounds of chemo, radiation, and herceptin.  I do not regret the chemo because my surgeon reminded me that it is the systemic treatment that keeps the cells from spreading.  It is your choice.  Find out as much as you can about your tumor, and get a second opinion.   I just wanted to let you know I am happy with my choice and 3 years out, I am NED (No Evidence of Disease)    Best wishes Pam
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy/Chemo and Radiation...HELP totaldo artsee

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2008 10:42AM TheShopMama wrote: Deb,  Winging our way on the magic carpet to be with you.  So glad the ativan helped.  Nausea and puking are horrible when you feel bad already.  Just wanted to remind you we are all praying for you and holding you close in our hearts.  God will be with you and I pray he grant you peace. Pam
Posts.Title: Dear Lord, I just scheduled brain surgery AlaskaDeb heymoose

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2009 09:45AM TheShopMama wrote: I have never been so disappointed.  I cannot believe Nicki has been banned from this site.  This board used to be my favorite place in the world to come and read.... to learn.... to find support.  It hurts very badly to know that someone who actually needs support, a newly diagnosed Stage IV is not even allowed to be here.  Some public board.  I received a lot of support when I was newly diagnosed.  I come back here to try and support others.  I support Nicki.  Shame on anyone who pursued her demise on this board!!!  All I can say is that you have to answer one day for all you have done.  I sure wouldn't want that on my conscious. Pam

Posts.Content: TheShopMama wrote: Hi ladies... I finished my rads almost two years ago, but still say that it was the best part of the worst part of my life because of the technicians who became my dear friends and supporters. A couple of years ago, the words to the Camp Nukemboobies theme song was posted here. It was to the tune of "Camp Granada" and oh so funny. I have been asked to "perform" this song at an awareness event in a couple of months. If any of you have this, please let me know! Thanks, Pam Laughter defies difficult moments their thievery of your joy. Dx 12/16/2008, DCIS, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
